value.title: DevOps dojo white belt foundations
value.excerpt: Familiarize yourself with DevOps basic concepts and principles.

topItems.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
topItems.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

images.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product

topItems.title: Define the foundation pillars of DevOps: Architecture and Technology
topItems.excerpt: There are three things required to make DevOps happen: the cultural component, tools and technology, and architecture. Discover the last two foundation pillars of DevOps, Architecture and Technology!

images.title: Define the foundation pillars of DevOps: Architecture and Technology

topItems.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
topItems.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

images.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration

topItems.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality.

images.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality
Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product

value.title: Introduce DevOps Dojo: Create efficiencies that support your business
value.excerpt: Start your DevOps Dojo journey.  Create multidisciplinary DevOps teams by using shared tools and processes that are designed to make your organization’s software development and implementation projects more efficient.

value.title: Learn about DevOps dojo white belt foundation
value.excerpt:
The DevOps dojo white belt foundation course aims to provide you with:

A high-level understanding of DevOps
A DevOps taxonomy to help familiarize and provide you with an understanding of DevOps concepts and principles

value.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
value.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering

value.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
value.excerpt: Network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

images.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how Site Reliability Engineering enables you to sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. They’ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.

images.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability
Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

value.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate security into your architecture design, and discover the tools that Azure provides to help you create a secure environment through all the layers of your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

value.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer. Find out how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI professionals. Explore common data engineering practices and a high-level architecting process for a data-engineering project.

images.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture

value.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Secure internal resources, external resources, SaaS applications, and more by using Azure Active Directory. Learn about the features and capabilities of Azure AD.

images.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory

value.title: Administer containers in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll create and manage your Azure Container Instances, and see how they can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Package a web app so that it can be deployed as a Docker image and run from an Azure Container Instance.

images.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry

topItems.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI).

images.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Administer containers in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure Container Instances are the quickest and easiest way to run containers in Azure. This learning path will teach you how to create and manage your containers, and how ACI can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Use API management to control who uses your APIs, to enforce usage policies, and to present a professional front-end to developers using the API.

images.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt:
API Management policies are configurable modules that you can add to APIs to change
their behaviors. Policies can do things like cache responses, transform documents and values,
call webhooks for notification or audit purposes, and retry requests after transient
failures. This module will use policies to enable caching in order to improve API performance
under load.

images.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

images.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

images.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, package, and deploy your applications.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: You want to build great things on Azure, but you’re not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.

images.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Scaling your system to handle load, identifying network bottlenecks, and optimizing your storage performance are important to ensure your users have the best experience. Learn how to make your application perform at its best.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency

value.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: NoSQL data is an efficient way to store information that doesn’t map to the requirements of a relational SQL database. Learn how to use the Azure portal, the Azure Cosmos DB extension for Visual Studio Code, and the Azure Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK to work with your NoSQL data where you want, and provide your users with high availability, no matter where they are in the world.
